AddUsersForUserManager.document:
This API is available for clusters with OpenLDAP components configured.
This API is used to add user lists (user management).
AddUsersForUserManager.name: Adds the user list

CreateCluster.document: This API is used to create an EMR cluster instance.
CreateCluster.name: Creates EMR cluster instances

CreateInstance.document: This API is used to create an EMR cluster instance.
CreateInstance.name: Creates EMR instance

DescribeClusterNodes.document: This API is used to query the information of nodes in a cluster.
DescribeClusterNodes.name: Queries the information of nodes in a cluster

DescribeEmrApplicationStatics.document: This API is used to query the Yarn application statistics.
DescribeEmrApplicationStatics.name: Queries the statistics of YARN tasks

DescribeInstances.document: This API is used to query the information of instances in a cluster.
DescribeInstances.name: Queries the information of instances in a cluster

DescribeInstancesList.document: This API is used to query the cluster list.
DescribeInstancesList.name: Queries the cluster list

DescribeResourceSchedule.document: This API is used to query the data of YARN Resource Scheduling.
DescribeResourceSchedule.name: Queries the data of YARN Resource Scheduling

DescribeUsersForUserManager.document:
This API is available for clusters with OpenLDAP components configured.
This API is used to export users in batches. For a Kerberos cluster, set `NeedKeytabInfo` to `true` to obtain the download link of the Keytab file. If `SupportDownLoadKeyTab` is `true`, but `DownLoadKeyTabUrl` is null, the Keytab file is not ready yet (being generated) in the backend.
DescribeUsersForUserManager.name: Queries the user list

InquiryPriceCreateInstance.document: This API is used to query price of instance creation.
InquiryPriceCreateInstance.name: Queries price of instance creation

InquiryPriceRenewInstance.document: This API is used to query the price for renewal.
InquiryPriceRenewInstance.name: Queries the price for renewal

InquiryPriceScaleOutInstance.document: This API is used to query price of scale-out.
InquiryPriceScaleOutInstance.name: Queries price of scale-out

InquiryPriceUpdateInstance.document: This API is used to query price of scaling.
InquiryPriceUpdateInstance.name: Queries price of scaling

ModifyResourceScheduleConfig.document: This API is used to modify the resource configuration of YARN Resource Scheduling.
ModifyResourceScheduleConfig.name: Modifies the resource configuration of YARN Resource Scheduling

ModifyResourceScheduler.document: This API is used to modify the YARN resource scheduler (the change will take effect after you click Apply).
ModifyResourceScheduler.name: Changes the resource scheduler of YARN

ScaleOutCluster.document: This API is used to scale out a cluster.
ScaleOutCluster.name: Scales out clusters

ScaleOutInstance.document: This API is used to scale out instances.
ScaleOutInstance.name: Scales out instances

TerminateInstance.document: This API is used to terminate EMR instances. It is only supported in the official paid edition of EMR.
TerminateInstance.name: Terminates EMR instances

TerminateTasks.document: This API is used to terminate a task node.
TerminateTasks.name: Terminates a task node

members.document:
Instance status code. Value range:
  • 2: cluster running
  • 3: creating cluster.
  • 4: scaling out cluster.
  • 5: adding router node in cluster.
  • 6: installing component in cluster.
  • 7: cluster executing command.
  • 8: restarting service.
  • 9: entering maintenance.
  • 10: suspending service.
  • 11: exiting maintenance.
  • 12: exiting suspension.
  • 13: delivering configuration.
  • 14: terminating cluster.
  • 15: terminating core node.
  • 16: terminating task node.
  • 17: terminating router node.
  • 18: changing webproxy password.
  • 19: isolating cluster.
  • 20: resuming cluster.
  • 21: repossessing cluster.
  • 22: waiting for configuration adjustment.
  • 23: cluster isolated.
  • 24: removing node.
  • 33: waiting for refund.
  • 34: refunded.
  • 301: creation failed.
  • 302: scale-out failed.
    • Note: this field may return null, indicating that no valid values can be obtained.
members.name: Status

members.document:
Purchase duration of instance, which needs to be used together with `TimeUnit`.
  • When `TimeUnit` is `s`, this parameter can only be filled with 3600, indicating a pay-as-you-go instance.
  • When `TimeUnit` is `m`, the number entered in this parameter indicates the purchase duration of the monthly-subscription instance; for example, 1 means one month
members.name: TimeSpan

members.document:
Time unit of instance purchase duration. Valid values:
  • s: seconds. When `PayMode` is 0, `TimeUnit` can only be `s`.
  • m: month. When `PayMode` is 1, `TimeUnit` can only be `m`.

members.document: The services to be deployed for new nodes. By default, new nodes will inherit all services deployed for the current node type. Deployed services include default optional services. This parameter only supports optional services. For example, if `HDFS`, `YARN`, and `Impala` have been deployed for existing task nodes, only `HDFS` and `YARN` are passed in with this parameter if `Impala` is not deployed during the task node scale-out with API.

members.document: The processes to be deployed. All processes for services to be added are deployed by default. Deployed processes can be changed. For example, `HDFS`, `YARN`, and `Impala` have been deployed for current task nodes, and default services are `DataNode`, `NodeManager`, and `ImpalaServer`; if you want to change deployed processes, you can set this parameter to `DataNode,NodeManager,ImpalaServerCoordinator` or `DataNode,NodeManager,ImpalaServerExecutor`.

members.document:
For a single AZ, `ZoneTag` can be left out. For a double-AZ mode, `ZoneTag` is set to `master` and `standby` for the first and second AZs, respectively. If there are three AZs, `ZoneTag` is set to `master`, `standby`, and `third-party` for the first, second, and third AZs, respectively. Valid values:
  • master
  • standby
  • third-party
    • Note: This field may return null, indicating that no valid values can be obtained.
